Treatment consists of an antibiotic eye drop or ointment for 8 days. In cases resistant to treatment or in encysted forms, incision at the free edge may be necessary. This is carried out under local anaesthetic on an outpatient basis.

question.title: What is the typical treatment for a stye?
question.description: A multiple-choice question about the treatment of a stye

option_a.title: Warm compresses and good hygiene
option_a.description: A common treatment for a stye

option_b.title: Antibiotic ointment and oral antibiotics
option_b.description: A common treatment for a stye

option_c.title: Surgery to drain the abscess
option_c.description: A possible treatment for a stye

option_d.title: Rest and observation
option_d.description: A treatment for a stye that is not typically recommended

correct_option.title: A
correct_option.description: The correct letter of the correct option
